conclusion: Determine the maximum value of the induced EMF as the loop enters the magnetic field.
The side length of the equilateral triangle is \(a\), moving to the right with velocity \(v\), and side \(CD\) is perpendicular to \(MN\).
The area of the triangle inside the magnetic field increases linearly with time.
Induced EMF is given by Faraday's law: \(\mathcal{E} = -\frac{d\Phi}{dt}\).
Magnetic flux \(\Phi = B \cdot A\), where \(A\) is the area inside the magnetic field.
Rate of change of area \(A\) is \(v \times\) length of the side entering the field.
Maximum area inside the magnetic field is half the area of the equilateral triangle.
Area of an equilateral triangle with side \(a\) is \(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4}a^2\).
Maximum area inside the magnetic field is \(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{8}a^2\).
Rate of change of area is \(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}av\).
